channel.title: How to share whonix connection using a Wi-Fi USB adapter as a hotspot under a VM?
channel.description:
Hello.
I wanna create PC-Gateway, which gives TOR connection to anybody, who connects to it.
I've choosen to use Windows host with Whonix Gateway as a guest VM. This station is connected to the internet by cable.
What are possible variants to share the VM's connection using a Wi-Fi USB adapter as a hotspot?
Thanks.

item.title: How to share whonix connection using a Wi-Fi USB adapter as a hotspot under a VM?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Doesn’t exist (yet).

See also:

Whonix-Gateway / Whonix-Workstation - Torified Wi-Fi Hotspot? Support
Hey guys, I’m essentially trying to achieve this same thing: Connecting a USB adapter to a Whonix Gateway and creating a wireless hotspot so that devices connected to the hotspot get routed through the tor network. Is this possible? I’m using an Ubuntu v16.0.4 host with Virtualbox v5 and the latest Whonix v13.0.0.1.4 Gateway. Any help configuring this would be greatly valued.

Read full topic
